fields.description:
I used to stage my files in File Status View by hitting the spacebar. This checked the checkbox of the selected file and staged in in prior versions of sourcetree.

Anyhow, after upgrading to 1.8, the spacebar is no longer working, which is a huge usability failure to me. Even worse, when I TAB myself to the checkbox (it is highlighted with the dotted grey border) and hit the spacebar, Sourcetree crashes completely. 

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.ToggleStaging(IFileStatusRecord fileStatusRecord) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\RepoTabViewModel.cs:line 833
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.Utils.CommandSink.ExecuteCommand(ICommand command, Object parameter, Boolean& handled) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\Utils\CommandSink.cs:line 112
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.Utils.CommandSinkBinding.<set_CommandSink>b__3_1(Object s, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\Utils\CommandSinkBinding.cs:line 46
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding.OnExecuted(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.ExecuteCommandBinding(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e, CommandBinding commandBinding)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.FindCommandBinding(CommandBindingCollection commandBindings, Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e, ICommand command, Boolean execute)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.FindCommandBinding(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e, ICommand command, Boolean execute)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.OnExecuted(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventHandlerInfo.InvokeHandler(Object target, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.ExecuteImpl(Object parameter, IInputElement target, Boolean userInitiated)
   at MS.Internal.Commands.CommandHelpers.CriticalExecuteCommandSource(ICommandSource commandSource, Boolean userInitiated)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnKeyUp(KeyEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventHandlerInfo.InvokeHandler(Object target, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseTrustedEvent(RoutedEventArgs args)

   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes, if selecting checkboxes in File Status View with Tab/Spacebar

fields.description:
The tabs (both the top ones, with repositories, and the bottom ones - File status, Log / History and Search) are too wide and have too much horizontal whitespace. I have several repositories with longer names open at the same time and while it worked perfectly fine in previous versions of SourceTree, now a horizontal spacebar appears under the tabs.
Reducing the font size in tab headers could also help. The current size seems not to be used elsewhere and it makes the tabs look a bit odd.
fields.summary: Tabs too wide

fields.description: Double-clicking on the Branches header above the branch list initiates a checkout of a branch called "Branches"
fields.summary: Branches list header acts as a branch itself

fields.description:
Opening serveral project-repos via command line interface does not work correctly. Sometimes some an sometimes all repos aren't opened. The feature works well with Sourcetree Version 1.7.0.32509.

Commands used (scripted, Example):

sourcetree.exe -f Q:\IT\Arbeitsgruppen\testq log
sourcetree.exe -f K:\q\IT\Arbeitsgruppen\testq log

As a workaraound, I downgraded to Version 1.7.0, which works well.
fields.summary: Buggy Command-Line Feature

fields.description:
When a repository is set to use an SSH remote URL, and the authentication is done using a private key, the push process, for example, hangs with this output:

{quote}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false commit -q -F D:\Temp\s5arqixk.lhh

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags --set-upstream origin master:master
Pushing to git@github.com:*<ommitted>*.git

The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You
have no guarantee that the server is the computer you

think it is.
The server's rsa2 key fingerprint is:
ssh-rsa 2048 ab:*<ommitted>*:9d

If you trust this host, enter "y" to add the key to
PuTTY's cache and carry on connecting.

If you want to carry on connecting just once, without
adding the key to the cache, enter "n".

If you do not trust this host, press Return to abandon the

connection.
{quote}

*As this message states, I would need to press {{y}} to continue, but I can't.* The only way I can push the changes to my repository is through the Terminal, which accepts the command {{git push}} and does what it should without any issues.
fields.summary: Git operations fail when using SSH with private key because user input is required to continue

fields.description: I want to ignore some files. When files are in sub-folder which name contains exclamation (or maybe space?) (e.g. "! Temp/MyFiles.src") then when you select "Ignore", files are still displayed as _unstaged_.
fields.summary: "Ignore" sometimes does not work

fields.description:
Clicking on the Help / Request A New Feature link opens a browser to https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa, which states:

"This is a live demonstration of JIRA. This server houses a test project, and is also used by Atlassian to track the development of JIRA, Confluence and other Atlassian products."

Should link to https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/SRCTREEWIN/summary, or change the text to be something useful about selecting a Project.
fields.summary: Help / Request A New Feature bad link
Sourcetree crashed after cloning remote branch

fields.description: I need to close SourceTree everytime I want to do an interactive git rebase on the command line (not the Terminal started from SourceTree).  I like to use SourceTree to view changes.  I can use command line git to view changes while doing a git rebase, so this is a purely SourceTree created issue :-(
fields.summary: interferes with command line git

fields.description:
Compared to command line git, SourceTree is just slow.

For example switching between files in a changeset takes long enough for it to display some animated progress thingy.

And it's worse if you switch away from the app, with several seconds of nothingness until it even gets focus, and then some amount of flickering.
fields.summary: SourceTree is just slow :-(

fields.description:
There should be an option to view a complete changeset, instead of having to click on every file individually.

This is especially tedious currently since there's a rather erratic behaviour where the display is not starting with the first hunk of the newly selected file, but at seemingly whatever percentage the view was at displaying the previous file.
fields.summary: option to view complete changesets, erratic behaviour when switching between files

fields.description:
When displaying individual hunks, git diff as well as regular diff with the -p option (Show which C function each change is in) displays the C function a change is in.  This is crucial information when reviewing changes.

Also, there should be a way to see more context around a hunk.
fields.summary: diff doesn't display C function name, and generally doesn't provide a way to see more context

fields.description:
The new UI buttons look very bad on Windows 7:
Buttons still have the windows 7 look on mouse over which is weird as the normal state has a completely different style.
fields.summary: New UI buttons look very bad on Windows 7

fields.description: We have lost the ability to right click on file diffs to do things like copy text ext.
fields.summary: Can't right click on file diff's

fields.description:
In the new version it is no longer possible to ctrl-click or shift select a range of items and then drag the to the staged list.
The mouse click simply selects whatever item is clicked when a selection already exists.
fields.summary: Multi-select in File Status view broken

fields.description:
After switching to "new refreshed UI" russian fonts became ugly and unreadable.

 !2016-02-27 19-00-04 SourceTree.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ugly cyrillic (russian) fonts in diff view

fields.description: See attached picture
fields.summary: code view is blurry

fields.description: SourceTree update installer, ostensibly identical to regular application installer, both always pin SourceTree to the user's taskbar. It would be nice to have a check-box allowing the user to opt out of this, and a registry key upon initial installation that saves the user's choice so update installers don't have to ask.
fields.summary: Installer should not pin SourceTree to taskbar

fields.description:
Before I upgraded from {{1.7.*}}, in the *Stage files* and *Unstaged files* sections in the *File status* tab, I could select a file and press {{space}} to have staged/unstaged. Now I have to move the mouse and click on the white square, which is less smooth. (n)

Also, when I do click that white square, the SourceTree UI flashes for some reason, before the file is moved to its new section.

...pls fix? :(
fields.summary: Space no longer works to (un)stage files

fields.description: The option is foreced to be enabled on startup.
fields.summary: "Allow SourceTree to modify global Git and Mercurial config files" option is broken

fields.description:
See attached. 
When Installing recent updates ( >= 1.8.1) earlier version of sourcetree are remaining installed. Attempts to uninstall return detailless windows errors about programs not being properly installed.  Kindly fix.
fields.summary: Sourcetree updates are installing concurrently

fields.description:
Upon starting SourceTree, I was asked to register by logging in to my Atlassian account.  That went fine.

Next, I was asked if I had a SSH key or wanted to install one later.  Upon choosing "later," the crash happened.

While writing this report, I was able to start SourceTree again and it announced a newer version available. After installing v1.8.2.3 everything seems fine.
fields.summary: Crash after login step

fields.description:
In the file diff preview pane, it was previously possible to navigate and make selections using the keyboard (arrow keys, shift, etc.).

Now it seems that keyboard input is completely disabled within the diff text itself, though the arrow keys move the focus around form the 'Stage lines', 'Discard lines', line numbers, and pane.

Keyboard functionality is critical for when the diff is longer than a few lines and the scroll bar is not visible and is also how myself and probably many others have become accustomed to using the interface. Hopefully this is a bug and not a design decision.
fields.summary: Keyboard input no longer functions within preview pane

fields.description:
Since the latest update today (1.8.2.3), I have to re-login to my Atlassian account every time I start sourcetree.  Uninstalling and reinstalling didn't help, nor did deleting the %profile%\AppData\Local\Atlassian folder.

If it matters, I'm using a Google login instead of an Atlassian account.
fields.summary: Atlassian login required on every launch

fields.description: You can not scroll horizontally in the code preview window.  Screenshot shows that the text extends past the display, but no scroll bars are enabled.
fields.summary: Cannot scroll in differences window

fields.description: when i click on any of the file showing up in 'Stage File Window' the Horizontal Scroll Bar is not visible as a result I can't view all the changes made to the file.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bars missing

fields.description:
On the ChangesetView control, the Horizontal Scrollbar is not shown even when the content of the Changeset exceeds the horizontal size of the client area. See "Missing-HBar-on-Code-ChangesetView.png".

 This issue is easily reproducible when selecting a changeset, in either "Log/History" or "File Status" tab, and then resizing down the application window until the control's client area is smaller than its content (code).

And no, the H ScrollBar is not at the bottom of the control even when scrolling down to its end.

Also i attached another screenshot with the inverse case, when the content is smaller than the control client area (small code chunks), the code box is now centered on the ChangesetView. This is a weird behaviour that as far as i remember it was not present on the old GUI. This makes binding line numbers to code lines visually difficult sometimes. See "Weird-Code-Centering.png"

I updated directly from the Old GUI versions up to 1.8.2.2, so i dont really know if this issue is already present on the in-between versions.
fields.summary: Horizontal ScrollBar missing on ChangeSetView
Crash after update

fields.description:
I updated to the latest available Windows version 1.8.2.2.  (If it matters, regarding Mercurial, I chose to indicate I would not be using Mercurial.  Regarding the registration logon, I chose to log in through my Google login.)

Since updating, now SourceTree always crashes on start up.  The issue indicated in the sourcetree.log is the following.

{code}
ERROR [...] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.InvalidOperationException: No glyphtypeface found
{code}

This actually fails multiple times for a single attempt to start SourceTree, which can lead to getting two duplicate error dialog windows that both identically suggest adding a bug issue.

A more complete sourtree.log excerpt is attached that holds the entries for multiple attempts to start SourceTree, as well as an attempt to Repair the installation after downloading a fresh copy of the latest Windows version.

The system is running Windows 7 Professional.
fields.summary: Startup Crash due to System.InvalidOperationException: No glyphtypeface found

fields.description:
SourceTree starts, runs a bit and exits. No GUI at all.
Uninstalled - Reinstalled - deleted local data. -- source tree.log empty.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
    <userSettings>
        <SourceTree.Properties.Settings>
            <setting name="UpgradeRequired" serializeAs="String"> (<<< Upgrade what??? >>>)
                <value>False</value>
            </setting>
        </SourceTree.Properties.Settings>
    </userSettings>
</configuration>
Please contact me.
fields.summary: SourceTree exits or abends.

fields.description:
see: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-3255

Also with 1.8.2.0 we now experience the problem that when you select a single line in order to stage/unstage or discard it, it will somtimes select multiple non-continuous lines instead of the selected one. Also sometimes (not always) a popup shows up when I want to stage/unstage/discard a single line, which says that it only can handle a continuous range of lines. But sometimes it works fine. Currently it works, so I cannot rephrase the exact wording of the dialog, but you probably know it.
Should I create a separate ticket for this issue?
Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Diff view selection. problem win continuous range

fields.description: Application crash for pull requests from origin or local repo.
fields.summary: Application crash for pull requests from origin or local repo

fields.description:
Space bar does not move files from unstaged to staged area and vice versa.

This was working in previous versions.

Only way to move items now is through mouse click or hot key.
fields.summary: Space bar does not move files from unstaged to staged area and vice versa

fields.description:
When there is a change in the last line of a file, and a lot of horizontal space is needed, the horizontal scrollbar overlaps the diff. This happens in the "File Status" and "Log / History" window.

See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Scrollbar overlaps diff

fields.description:
Sorry for my pool English. I'm a Chinese guy.

Unsure this is a bug, but please check attachment. My display resolution is 2560 x 1080 (21:9).
fields.summary: width of the diff screen

fields.description:
When changing the sort method to "Pending files, sorted by path", the Unstaged files is sorted properly.

Once you stage the first file/change, the Unstaged files list sorts all tracked files (properly) at the top and all untracked files at the bottom.

Please see screenshot for reference.

*UPDATE*: What actually happens is when the lists are refreshed (whether automatically or via View -> Refresh), the sorted column becomes unsorted. So, when using "Pending files, sorted by path", the "Path" column is sorted. After a refresh, the "Path" column becomes unsorted.
fields.summary: Unstaged files sorts untracked incorrectly

fields.description:
I upgraded to 1.8.2.2 from 1.7.0.32509 and the installer went through fine.

After it completed, I checked the box to start SourceTree. When SourceTree started, it crashed with a {{System.NullReferenceException}}. I've attached a truncated portion of the log showing the output and crash from today.

I then restarted it and it seems to work.. though I did notice an error in SourceTree handling one of our submodules.
fields.summary: After upgrading to 1.8.2.2 from 1.7.0.32509, starting SourceTree crashes

fields.description: After changing the encoding to Windows-1258 produces an error launching the application!
fields.summary: Critical error running !

fields.description:
There are new files in my project, the favorites list clearly indicates that there are 2 new files, yet, there's nothing in the staging lists.

https://i.imgur.com/4XayxpN.png

This has been happening in SourceTree since forever.
fields.summary: Doesn't show changed/new files
Git hooks fail on Sourcetree only

fields.description:
Here's the output for pulling from a remote branch. It works, but the errors don't look very promising. Also, maybe it's the reason why ST is so atrociously slow.

{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin
C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: line 2: $'\r': command not found

C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: line 8: $'\r': command not found


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull --rebase origin features/locatiezoeker-2.0
C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: line 2: $'\r': command not found

C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: line 8: $'\r': command not found

From ssh://beheer.siteworkers.nl:7999/yar/yardenpresentation
 * branch            features/locatiezoeker-2.0 -> FETCH_HEAD


Current branch features/locatiezoeker-2.0 is up to date.


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
Completed successfully.
{noformat}

Affects version 1.7.0 (which apparently doesn't exist?)
fields.summary: $'\r': command not found

fields.description:
I tried to open the .suo file from my Visual Studio .NET project.
After this SourceTree crashed.
In the log, you can find the exception message "The specified file has no associated application".
fields.summary: SourceTree crash when try to open an unknown file extension

fields.description: Crash while scrolling "Stage files" and "Unstaged files"
fields.summary: Crash while scrolling "Stage files" and "Unstaged files"

fields.description: Even with "Refresh automatically when files change" option turned off, alt-tabbing to ST makes it unresponsive for 4-5s.
fields.summary: ST hangs after Alt-Tab

fields.description: SourceTree crashes after closing the merge-window of kdiff3. To replicate the problem just create a conflict, solve it using kdiff3 and save and close kdiff3.
fields.summary: Crash after Merge with Kdiff3
Bring back the 'Open containing folder'
Scroll bar linenumbers bar in diff section.
After P4Merge usage for conflicts, SourceTree (1.8.2.2) crashes

fields.description:
When a number of files are selected and highlighted, its is no longer possible to drag&drop the selected files from one pane to another (staged/unstaged).

Instead, the selection changes based on the mouse movements.
fields.summary: No longer possible to drag/drop a multiple files in a selection from staged to unstagged abnd vice-verase

fields.description: If you select the "Tags" heading in a Git repository and right-click, the "Checkout Tags" context menu appears. If you select "Details" in that menu, SourceTree apparently tries to get details for the non-existent "Tags" tag, leading to an error.
fields.summary: Wrong context menu appears on "Tags" heading, leading to error.

fields.description:
I am testing the latest release candidate for release 1.8.2.3

*Reproduce steps*
# Open SourceTree (Fresh open needed)
# Drag to move the separator (indicated as red line in screenshot)
# The panel doesn't resize at all

If i select second file in unstaged panel the problem goes away.
fields.summary: Unable to resize staging panel in Log/History tab

fields.description: Crash after upgrade and completing setup steps.
fields.summary: Crash after update to 1.8.2.2

fields.description: I used to be able to select some unstaged files and stage them using the space bar. Now it's no longer possible to stage all selected unstaged files.
fields.summary: Multiple files can no longer be staged together

fields.description: When resolving a file with a conflict using Launch external merge tool, every time upon returning from KDiff3, SourceTree crashes (completely stops). The file is merged correctly, but this is very annoying.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.8.2.0 crashes every time after finishing Resolve conflict -> Launch external merge tool

fields.description:
Tree View file listing not working..

Please see the attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Tree View file listing not working

fields.description:
It would be useful to get system tray/envelope notifications along the lines one sees for programs like Microsoft Outlook or any number of other such programs. Though it's better if it is a configurable option since not everyone may want these notifications.

Also, these notifications should be for the selected clone repositories (user should be able to select which ones).
fields.summary: Feature Request: System tray notifications on SourceTree

fields.description: After selecting any line with mouse the "Stage hunk" button changes into "Stage lines" and there is no way to stage full hunk anymore.
fields.summary: No way to "Stage hunk" after selecting any line

fields.description:
1. Attempted to merge a branch into another as normal.
2. Received some conflicts to resolve
3. Right click a conflicted file and select "Resolve Conflict > External Merge Tool"
4. Currently have Beyond Compare 3 configured, It launches and you can complete the merge as normal
5. Close beyond compare and save the merge

Source Tree crashes. This is repeatable.

Not sure how to get any logs, just got a standard window app has crashed prompt which normally means its been uncaught. I attached visual studio debugger to it and got this exception

System.NullReferenceException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf.dll
Additional information: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
fields.summary: Source Tree Crashed after Launching External Merge Tool

fields.description: Just upgraded from 1.5.2 to 1.8.2.2 and upon launch got crash notice.
fields.summary: Crashed upon starting
Sometimes can not input Chinese in the comment box

fields.description:
When attempting to stage or unstage files in SourceTree using keyboard navigation, the application crashes. Logfile shows the following stack trace:

ERROR [2016-02-26 10:52:37,250] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.ToggleStaging(IFileStatusRecord fileStatusRecord) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\RepoTabViewModel.cs:line 833
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.Utils.CommandSink.ExecuteCommand(ICommand command, Object parameter, Boolean& handled) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\Utils\CommandSink.cs:line 112
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.Utils.CommandSinkBinding.<set_CommandSink>b__3_1(Object s, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\Utils\CommandSinkBinding.cs:line 46
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding.OnExecuted(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.ExecuteCommandBinding(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e, CommandBinding commandBinding)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.FindCommandBinding(CommandBindingCollection commandBindings, Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e, ICommand command, Boolean execute)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.FindCommandBinding(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e, ICommand command, Boolean execute)
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandManager.OnExecuted(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventHandlerInfo.InvokeHandler(Object target, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.ExecuteImpl(Object parameter, IInputElement target, Boolean userInitiated)
   at MS.Internal.Commands.CommandHelpers.CriticalExecuteCommandSource(ICommandSource commandSource, Boolean userInitiated)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnKeyUp(KeyEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventHandlerInfo.InvokeHandler(Object target, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseTrustedEvent(RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Input.InputManager.ProcessStagingArea()
   at System.Windows.Input.InputProviderSite.ReportInput(InputReport inputReport)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndKeyboardInputProvider.ProcessKeyAction(MSG& msg, Boolean& handled)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.CriticalTranslateAccelerator(MSG& msg, ModifierKeys modifiers)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.OnPreprocessMessage(Object param)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)

Steps to reproduce (when staging a file):
1. Click on an unstaged file
2. Press the tab key once, to move the focus to the checkbox next to that file.
3. Press the Space key to "check" that checkbox.

Same sequence also applies when trying to unstage a file.

This is probably part of a broader issue, whereby the Space key is generally busted for the purposes of navigation... it seems a lot of controls don't respect it (eg. it does not show the dropdown menus when pressing Space with a dropdown button in focus).
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when staging or unstaging a file

fields.description:
When staging unstaged files to be committed, every click of a checkbox causes the full output to appear. When you have several items to stage/unstage this is a huge pain.
Is there a setting to revert to the old behaviour ?
fields.summary: Staging causing the full process window to appear.

fields.description:
After upgrading to the latest version of SourceTree, I thought I would point out a few things I've noticed that don't seem quite right to me.

1) My Global Ignore List seems to have completely gone after the upgrade. I have had to reconstruct it.
fields.summary: Git Global Ignore missing

fields.description:
see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-3722


Log/History (C:\PROJECT\FMI-MDS) shows an unconnected item in the list.
It's from another git repository (C:\PROJEKT\HyperManager)
See attached: loglist_bug.png

Git on the command line shows no hint.
See attached: git_log.png git_status.png

Both FMI-MDS and HyperManager was in the bookmarks list.
FMI-MDS was on the first tab of open repositories.
Can't remember ig HyperManager was open.

Best guess of how it happened.
Sourcetree was not started. 
C:\PROJEKT\HyperManager got renamed on disk.
New project got created in C:\PROJEKT\HyperManager
git was not initialized in C:\PROJEKT\HyperManager
Sourcetree was started
Probably some warning about HyperManager
HyperManager was deleted from bookmarks
I noticed "1 pull and 15 push" in toolbar. See toolbar.png
The pull and push points to HyperManager on our internal git server

Attached: sourcetree.log
Best guess for when it happened is 2016-02-16 11:26:38
The stacktrace above seems unrelated.
The mentioned LastFailedPatch.txt starts with
""
diff --git a/HyperManager.Tests/App.config b/HyperManager.Tests/App.config
— a/HyperManager.Tests/App.config 
+++ b/HyperManager.Tests/App.config 
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
""
fields.summary: Log/history shows content from unrelated git repository

fields.description: Installing 1.8.2.2 as an update of 1.8.2, I registered for an atlassian account from the welcome dialog, then skipped the repo setup and immediately crashed.
fields.summary: Crash on last step of installer after skipping repo setup

fields.description:
See attachment.

The way the diff window looks when the code is not wide enough to fill the window is distracting. It would be preferable that the white background stretch 100% of the width and the code remain aligned to the left.
fields.summary: Diff output window is center-aligning but should left-align

fields.description:
Prior to 1.8.1 you could multi select files from the unstaged tab & drag & drop them to the staged files tab.

This functionality no longer works. The only way to move between unstaged & staged files now is via the checkbox, which when dealing with lots of files to commit in one instance is painful.
fields.summary: Drag & drop between unstaged & staged file

fields.description:
I just enabled Git LFS for a repository using the new Git LFS functionality from SourceTree. This repository already existed on BitBucket.

When I hit the push button, I get this error message:

"git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags 3M_BitBucket Transferencia:Transferencia development:development master:master
Pushing to git@bitbucket.org:mfeinstein/3m.git

\nThis repository is configured for Git LFS but 'git-lfs' was not found on your path. If you no longer wish to use Git LFS, remove this hook by deleting .git/hooks/pre-push.\n

error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:mfeinstein/3m.git'

Completed with errors, see above."

I have Git-LFS installed in my computer, and I know it's on my %PATH% variables because I can call it from cmd.exe.
fields.summary: Git LFS Error On Push

fields.description: First, the issue that I am documenting is a new issue.  I recently upgraded from v1.6 to v1.8.2.2, and this new behavior strikes me as very annoying.  I work with a lot of sub-modules, and whenever I open a tab for a new sub-module or switch between tabs I often see that the view below the graph defaults to File Status even when there is no File Status to show.  9 times out of 10, I am switching tabs to look at Log / History and that is what I want to see first.  That is what I am used to seeing.  Now I have to do a lot more pointing and clicking around in order to get to the view that I am interested in.  If others like this current behavior, then I recommend adding an option for me to specify which tab to show first (e.g., File Status, Log / History, Search).
fields.summary: Default to Log / History or the last tab selected by the user
Popup when tapping a branch in the left menu

fields.description:
This has happened to teammates when working with sub-modules.  Here is a quick way to test.

# Manually check out any commit that doesn't have a branch pointing to it.
# Observe a warning that you are in the detached head state
# Make a small change to a file.
# Commit the change.
# Source tree will commit the change without warning. 

Now, if the user doesn't realize what has happened then the commit could eventually be lost from the sourcetree graph.  SRCTREEWIN-1227 was supposed to have fixed this, but I don't see a warning of any kind.  The reality is that when working with sub-modules a pull operation can cause a detached head within sub-modules and the user will not be warned about it.  Then the user might commit to the sub-module without realizing what happened.  Days later, people are confused by the fact that commits that they made have simply disappeared.
fields.summary: There is no warning when committing to a detached head
after doing latest update, Sourcetree crashed while trying to change config

fields.description:
Hi guys,

It seems like the file difference sections in newest SourceTree are misaligned. I think those white backgrounds for where the code is displayed should go fullwidth of the container. Am I wrong?

Please see attached screenshot for better explanation.

Regards,

Oliver
fields.summary: File difference layout issue

fields.description:
When I have to merge, I the external tool p4merge.
*I did not update it and it was working perfectly in version 1.7. ...*

Now each time I use it, and save the modification, SourceTree crashes.

{color:red}This is very annoying.{color}
fields.summary: Crash when using external merge tool
Started Source Tree after update and it crashed

fields.description:
When clicking on a file with lines longer than 65533 characters, e.g. from a js/css minifyer, SourceTree crashes immediately, probably while trying to display a diff / preview in the lower right window. 
I tried it with various files, containing compressed css as well as arbitrary characters and numbers, it always crashes completely.
There is no difference if the file is already committed or not.
fields.summary: Crash with lines longer than 65533 characters

fields.description:
Trying to clone a repository made SourceTree crash with an error message just when the clone process completed.

The repository was cloned successfully and the code was undamaged.

Error trace from log file attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash after cloning repo

fields.description: I was using SourceTree and trying to clone a repo from our local BitBucket server.  The app crashed and requested to place a defect report.  Attached is the sourcetree.log file that the app asked to include with this report.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashed

fields.description: When I click a commit to view the file changes everything freezes up and I have to kill the application.
fields.summary: Crashing when clicking on commit

fields.description: The default comparator is very bad. A better solution should be to implement a comparator like Windiff or one of same level. Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Requesto to implement a better comparator (i.e. like Windiff)

fields.description:
Update:

I've reconsidered my stance on Fluid Staging and I actually like the new 1.8.x workflow even better. Please reject this issue.

Original text:

I know that Fluid Staging was deprecated on purpose and there are probably good reasons (like simplifying code and/or performance), but I love Fluid Staging! Please consider bringing it back.
fields.summary: Please reject this issue (was: Bring back Fluid Staging)

fields.description: Every time I go to create a pull request, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crashes when creating pull request

fields.description:
Each point of the git tree is slightly offsetted resulting in an unreadable tree.

It can be seen as soon as a repo is selected

See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Git tree not displayed properly (commits not on their lines)

fields.description:
The bug is extremely easy to understand, and hopefully also to be fixed.

Just compare the two screenshots, showing same file diff.

One shows the correct diff, from command line terminal.

Other shows the incorrect diff, according to Source Tree.

As we can see, the final "}" line is missing.
fields.summary: Code diff appearing incorrectly

fields.description:
I used to be able to select multiple lines in the diff panel by selecting one line, holding {{Shift}} and selecting another line. This selected all lines in between.
This was especially useful when selecting a large number of lines.
fields.summary: Selecting multiple lines no longer possible by holding "Shift"

fields.description:
See attached image. I'd expect that:
# All hunks are left-aligned
# All hunks have the same width (maximal width within that window)

The way it is displayed right now makes it hard to read the content
fields.summary: Hunks in preview of staging area in git have different width based on content making them hard to work with.

fields.description:
New UI is hard on the eyes, there is not much visual cues and this minimalistic grayscale design may look good in the hipster art gallery but it's bad UX — this is 2016 we have color monitors now :P

And while where'at it there is nothing bad with little 3D effects in the icons and all, I suppose developer machines can handle that extra rendering.

Our eyes are long time past warranty covered mileage, pleas be gentle on them.
fields.summary: More visual cues in UI for Windows 10

fields.description:
What is going on with the file diff view?  Center justified code snippets? See attached picture.

I do need to say that this last series of updates on both Mac and Windows have been quite disruptive. I really think you need to work on your QA process, and get some actual testing into the product prior to releasing it.
fields.summary: File diff view is wonky

fields.description: I just updated from 1.8.2.? to 1.8.2.2. The toolbar got reset during the update and now I have no way to change it.
fields.summary: no way to customize toolbar

fields.description:
The context menu that appears when you right-click on the Branches root icon does NOT include New Branch... menu item like it did in prior versions. 

Please bring it back!

I see it in the Ribbon Bar, but it's a key element to Branch activity and excluding it from the UI is counter-intuitive.
fields.summary: New Branch missing from right-clicking Branches root

fields.description:
On installing the latest update, SourceTree shut itself down as instructed. Updates were done, but then when it tried starting up again, I got a 'Oops I've crashed' message and was directed here. Error log attached.

It's starting fine now though, so not a major issue
fields.summary: Crash on installing update

fields.description: I think that the diff file visualization styling could be improved. I don't really like it.
fields.summary: Improve diff file visualization

fields.description:
In previous version you could drag and drop changed files from the unstaged area to the staged area as a user-friendly way of doing a git add. This no longer works. You can't drag files in either of those views any more (so you can unstage things either).

In addition, multiple selections are lost as soon as you click on a selected item, so even if drag 'n' drop was working you would still only be able to do it one file at a time.
fields.summary: Can no longer stage files using drag 'n' drop

fields.description:
1. have an merge conflict
2. launch external merge tool (I use KDiff3)
3. resolve the conflict and close merge tool after saving the result
4. app crashes with NullReferenceException

fields.description:
... also ugly grey background.

see attachment.
fields.summary: Diff panel of changes seems to be centre aligned.

fields.description:
After updating Sourcetree to v1.8.2.2 it started crashing when I exit external merge tool (tortoise merge).

System.NullReferenceException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf.dll
Additional information: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
fields.summary: Crash on Exit External Merge Tool

fields.description: Hitting spacebar in staged/unstaged views no longer selects/unselects highlighted files. Given that staging a file is a very slow operation with SourceTree (around 5 seconds here) it's essential to be able to highlight multiple files and 'batch' select to stage.
fields.summary: Spacebar in file status staged/unstaged views

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.8.2.2 crashes after every visual merge. The merge tool is P4Merge. At least the merge is not lost.

{code}
Anwendung: SourceTree.exe
Frameworkversion: v4.0.30319
Beschreibung: Der Prozess wurde aufgrund einer unbehandelten Ausnahme beendet.
Ausnahmeinformationen: System.NullReferenceException
Stapel:
   bei SourceTree.ViewModel.VisualMergeWindowViewModel.MergeProcessOnCompleted(System.Object, System.EventArgs)
   bei SourceTree.Utils.RepoProcess.OnCompleted()
   bei SourceTree.Utils.RepoProcess.DoCompletionFunctions()
   bei System.Diagnostics.Process.RaiseOnExited()
   bei System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
   bei System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
   bei System.Threading._ThreadPoolWaitOrTimerCallback.PerformWaitOrTimerCallback(System.Object, Boolean)
{code}
fields.summary: Crash after visual merge
